column4: any idea why one would loose the rotation ability in nvidia-config after a bios failure?
bios interacts with the hardware so if that dies in theory u would lose everything
it didnt die, as i reset it (jumper) and was able too recover the system without further incident... but i lost the ability too rotate output for portrait view, and now my gfx card runs too hot
:o umm u may have broken something somewhere, umm update + upgrade and do apt-get check
ive done that many many times since this happened
how.. my xorg.conf is empty.. and has been since i upgraded too jaunty (which screen rotate worked after the Jump)
if xorg.conf is empty u NEED to reconfigure
yes but u cannot rotate the screen which xorg does
ok, how do i reconfigure nvidia-xorg?
no u need to reconfigure X11
woaw, i already did that once and it reset my drivers setting too use the on board graphic; do not want!
perhaps i should mention this is on the nvidia 180 drivers? SealV too
if no one else can help ubuntu forums
